005package edu.wpi.first.math.geometry;
006
007import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonAutoDetect;
008import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonCreator;
009import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonIgnoreProperties;
010import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonProperty;
011import edu.wpi.first.math.MatBuilder;
012import edu.wpi.first.math.MathSharedStore;
013import edu.wpi.first.math.MathUtil;
014import edu.wpi.first.math.Matrix;
015import edu.wpi.first.math.Nat;
016import edu.wpi.first.math.VecBuilder;
017import edu.wpi.first.math.Vector;
018import edu.wpi.first.math.interpolation.Interpolatable;
019import edu.wpi.first.math.numbers.N3;
020import java.util.Objects;
021import org.ejml.dense.row.factory.DecompositionFactory_DDRM;
022
023/** A rotation in a 3D coordinate frame represented by a quaternion. */
024@JsonIgnoreProperties(ignoreUnknown = true)
025@JsonAutoDetect(getterVisibility = JsonAutoDetect.Visibility.NONE)
026public class Rotation3d implements Interpolatable<Rotation3d> {
027  private Quaternion m_q = new Quaternion();
028
029  /** Constructs a Rotation3d with a default angle of 0 degrees. */
030  public Rotation3d() {}
031
032  /**
033   * Constructs a Rotation3d from a quaternion.
034   *
035   * @param q The quaternion.
036   */
037  @JsonCreator
038  public Rotation3d(@JsonProperty(required = true, value = "quaternion") Quaternion q) {
039    m_q = q.normalize();
040  }
041
042  /**
043   * Constructs a Rotation3d from extrinsic roll, pitch, and yaw.
044   *
045   * <p>Extrinsic rotations occur in that order around the axes in the fixed global frame rather
046   * than the body frame.
047   *
048   * @param roll The counterclockwise rotation angle around the X axis (roll) in radians.
049   * @param pitch The counterclockwise rotation angle around the Y axis (pitch) in radians.
050   * @param yaw The counterclockwise rotation angle around the Z axis (yaw) in radians.
051   */
052  public Rotation3d(double roll, double pitch, double yaw) {
053    // https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conversion_between_quaternions_and_Euler_angles#Euler_angles_to_quaternion_conversion
054    double cr = Math.cos(roll * 0.5);
055    double sr = Math.sin(roll * 0.5);
056
057    double cp = Math.cos(pitch * 0.5);
058    double sp = Math.sin(pitch * 0.5);
059
060    double cy = Math.cos(yaw * 0.5);
061    double sy = Math.sin(yaw * 0.5);
062
063    m_q =
064        new Quaternion(
065            cr * cp * cy + sr * sp * sy,
066            sr * cp * cy - cr * sp * sy,
067            cr * sp * cy + sr * cp * sy,
068            cr * cp * sy - sr * sp * cy);
069  }
070
071  /**
072   * Constructs a Rotation3d with the given axis-angle representation. The axis doesn't have to be
073   * normalized.
074   *
075   * @param axis The rotation axis.
076   * @param angleRadians The rotation around the axis in radians.
077   */
078  public Rotation3d(Vector<N3> axis, double angleRadians) {
079    double norm = axis.norm();
080    if (norm == 0.0) {
081      return;
082    }
083
084    // https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conversion_between_quaternions_and_Euler_angles#Definition
085    var v = axis.times(1.0 / norm).times(Math.sin(angleRadians / 2.0));
086    m_q = new Quaternion(Math.cos(angleRadians / 2.0), v.get(0, 0), v.get(1, 0), v.get(2, 0));
087  }
088
089  /**
090   * Constructs a Rotation3d from a rotation matrix.
091   *
092   * @param rotationMatrix The rotation matrix.
093   * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the rotation matrix isn't special orthogonal.
094   */
095  public Rotation3d(Matrix<N3, N3> rotationMatrix) {
096    final var R = rotationMatrix;
097
098    // Require that the rotation matrix is special orthogonal. This is true if
099    // the matrix is orthogonal (RRáµ€ = I) and normalized (determinant is 1).
100    if (!R.times(R.transpose()).equals(Matrix.eye(Nat.N3()))) {
101      var builder = new StringBuilder("Rotation matrix isn't orthogonal\n\nR =\n");
102      builder.append(R.getStorage().toString()).append('\n');
103
104      var msg = builder.toString();
105      MathSharedStore.reportError(msg, Thread.currentThread().getStackTrace());
106      throw new IllegalArgumentException(msg);
107    }
108    if (R.det() != 1.0) {
109      var builder =
110          new StringBuilder("Rotation matrix is orthogonal but not special orthogonal\n\nR =\n");
111      builder.append(R.getStorage().toString()).append('\n');
112
113      var msg = builder.toString();
114      MathSharedStore.reportError(msg, Thread.currentThread().getStackTrace());
115      throw new IllegalArgumentException(msg);
116    }
117
118    // Turn rotation matrix into a quaternion
119    // https://www.euclideanspace.com/maths/geometry/rotations/conversions/matrixToQuaternion/
120    double trace = R.get(0, 0) + R.get(1, 1) + R.get(2, 2);
121    double w;
122    double x;
123    double y;
124    double z;
125
126    if (trace > 0.0) {
127      double s = 0.5 / Math.sqrt(trace + 1.0);
128      w = 0.25 / s;
129      x = (R.get(2, 1) - R.get(1, 2)) * s;
130      y = (R.get(0, 2) - R.get(2, 0)) * s;
131      z = (R.get(1, 0) - R.get(0, 1)) * s;
132    } else {
133      if (R.get(0, 0) > R.get(1, 1) && R.get(0, 0) > R.get(2, 2)) {
134        double s = 2.0 * Math.sqrt(1.0 + R.get(0, 0) - R.get(1, 1) - R.get(2, 2));
135        w = (R.get(2, 1) - R.get(1, 2)) / s;
136        x = 0.25 * s;
137        y = (R.get(0, 1) + R.get(1, 0)) / s;
138        z = (R.get(0, 2) + R.get(2, 0)) / s;
139      } else if (R.get(1, 1) > R.get(2, 2)) {
140        double s = 2.0 * Math.sqrt(1.0 + R.get(1, 1) - R.get(0, 0) - R.get(2, 2));
141        w = (R.get(0, 2) - R.get(2, 0)) / s;
142        x = (R.get(0, 1) + R.get(1, 0)) / s;
143        y = 0.25 * s;
144        z = (R.get(1, 2) + R.get(2, 1)) / s;
145      } else {
146        double s = 2.0 * Math.sqrt(1.0 + R.get(2, 2) - R.get(0, 0) - R.get(1, 1));
147        w = (R.get(1, 0) - R.get(0, 1)) / s;
148        x = (R.get(0, 2) + R.get(2, 0)) / s;
149        y = (R.get(1, 2) + R.get(2, 1)) / s;
150        z = 0.25 * s;
151      }
152    }
153
154    m_q = new Quaternion(w, x, y, z);
155  }
156
157  /**
158   * Constructs a Rotation3d that rotates the initial vector onto the final vector.
159   *
160   * <p>This is useful for turning a 3D vector (final) into an orientation relative to a coordinate
161   * system vector (initial).
162   *
163   * @param initial The initial vector.
164   * @param last The final vector.
165   */
166  public Rotation3d(Vector<N3> initial, Vector<N3> last) {
167    double dot = initial.dot(last);
168    double normProduct = initial.norm() * last.norm();
169    double dotNorm = dot / normProduct;
170
171    if (dotNorm > 1.0 - 1E-9) {
172      // If the dot product is 1, the two vectors point in the same direction so
173      // there's no rotation. The default initialization of m_q will work.
174      return;
175    } else if (dotNorm < -1.0 + 1E-9) {
176      // If the dot product is -1, the two vectors point in opposite directions
177      // so a 180 degree rotation is required. Any orthogonal vector can be used
178      // for it. Q in the QR decomposition is an orthonormal basis, so it
179      // contains orthogonal unit vectors.
180      var X =
181          new MatBuilder<>(Nat.N3(), Nat.N1())
182              .fill(initial.get(0, 0), initial.get(1, 0), initial.get(2, 0));
183      final var qr = DecompositionFactory_DDRM.qr(3, 1);
184      qr.decompose(X.getStorage().getMatrix());
185      final var Q = qr.getQ(null, false);
186
187      // w = cos(Î¸/2) = cos(90Â°) = 0
188      //
189      // For x, y, and z, we use the second column of Q because the first is
190      // parallel instead of orthogonal. The third column would also work.
191      m_q = new Quaternion(0.0, Q.get(0, 1), Q.get(1, 1), Q.get(2, 1));
192    } else {
193      // initial x last
194      var axis =
195          VecBuilder.fill(
196              initial.get(1, 0) * last.get(2, 0) - last.get(1, 0) * initial.get(2, 0),
197              last.get(0, 0) * initial.get(2, 0) - initial.get(0, 0) * last.get(2, 0),
198              initial.get(0, 0) * last.get(1, 0) - last.get(0, 0) * initial.get(1, 0));
199
200      // https://stackoverflow.com/a/11741520
201      m_q =
202          new Quaternion(normProduct + dot, axis.get(0, 0), axis.get(1, 0), axis.get(2, 0))
203              .normalize();
204    }
205  }
206
207  /**
208   * Adds two rotations together.
209   *
210   * @param other The rotation to add.
211   * @return The sum of the two rotations.
212   */
213  public Rotation3d plus(Rotation3d other) {
214    return rotateBy(other);
215  }
216
217  /**
218   * Subtracts the new rotation from the current rotation and returns the new rotation.
219   *
220   * @param other The rotation to subtract.
221   * @return The difference between the two rotations.
222   */
223  public Rotation3d minus(Rotation3d other) {
224    return rotateBy(other.unaryMinus());
225  }
226
227  /**
228   * Takes the inverse of the current rotation.
229   *
230   * @return The inverse of the current rotation.
231   */
232  public Rotation3d unaryMinus() {
233    return new Rotation3d(m_q.inverse());
234  }
235
236  /**
237   * Multiplies the current rotation by a scalar.
238   *
239   * @param scalar The scalar.
240   * @return The new scaled Rotation3d.
241   */
242  public Rotation3d times(double scalar) {
243    // https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Slerp#Quaternion_Slerp
244    if (m_q.getW() >= 0.0) {
245      return new Rotation3d(
246          VecBuilder.fill(m_q.getX(), m_q.getY(), m_q.getZ()),
247          2.0 * scalar * Math.acos(m_q.getW()));
248    } else {
249      return new Rotation3d(
250          VecBuilder.fill(-m_q.getX(), -m_q.getY(), -m_q.getZ()),
251          2.0 * scalar * Math.acos(-m_q.getW()));
252    }
253  }
254
255  /**
256   * Divides the current rotation by a scalar.
257   *
258   * @param scalar The scalar.
259   * @return The new scaled Rotation3d.
260   */
261  public Rotation3d div(double scalar) {
262    return times(1.0 / scalar);
263  }
264
265  /**
266   * Adds the new rotation to the current rotation.
267   *
268   * @param other The rotation to rotate by.
269   * @return The new rotated Rotation3d.
270   */
271  public Rotation3d rotateBy(Rotation3d other) {
272    return new Rotation3d(other.m_q.times(m_q));
273  }
274
275  /**
276   * Returns the quaternion representation of the Rotation3d.
277   *
278   * @return The quaternion representation of the Rotation3d.
279   */
280  @JsonProperty(value = "quaternion")
281  public Quaternion getQuaternion() {
282    return m_q;
283  }
284
285  /**
286   * Returns the counterclockwise rotation angle around the X axis (roll) in radians.
287   *
288   * @return The counterclockwise rotation angle around the X axis (roll) in radians.
289   */
290  public double getX() {
291    final var w = m_q.getW();
292    final var x = m_q.getX();
293    final var y = m_q.getY();
294    final var z = m_q.getZ();
295
296    // https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conversion_between_quaternions_and_Euler_angles#Quaternion_to_Euler_angles_conversion
297    return Math.atan2(2.0 * (w * x + y * z), 1.0 - 2.0 * (x * x + y * y));
298  }
299
300  /**
301   * Returns the counterclockwise rotation angle around the Y axis (pitch) in radians.
302   *
303   * @return The counterclockwise rotation angle around the Y axis (pitch) in radians.
304   */
305  public double getY() {
306    final var w = m_q.getW();
307    final var x = m_q.getX();
308    final var y = m_q.getY();
309    final var z = m_q.getZ();
310
311    // https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conversion_between_quaternions_and_Euler_angles#Quaternion_to_Euler_angles_conversion
312    double ratio = 2.0 * (w * y - z * x);
313    if (Math.abs(ratio) >= 1.0) {
314      return Math.copySign(Math.PI / 2.0, ratio);
315    } else {
316      return Math.asin(ratio);
317    }
318  }
319
320  /**
321   * Returns the counterclockwise rotation angle around the Z axis (yaw) in radians.
322   *
323   * @return The counterclockwise rotation angle around the Z axis (yaw) in radians.
324   */
325  public double getZ() {
326    final var w = m_q.getW();
327    final var x = m_q.getX();
328    final var y = m_q.getY();
329    final var z = m_q.getZ();
330
331    // https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conversion_between_quaternions_and_Euler_angles#Quaternion_to_Euler_angles_conversion
332    return Math.atan2(2.0 * (w * z + x * y), 1.0 - 2.0 * (y * y + z * z));
333  }
334
335  /**
336   * Returns the axis in the axis-angle representation of this rotation.
337   *
338   * @return The axis in the axis-angle representation.
339   */
340  public Vector<N3> getAxis() {
341    double norm =
342        Math.sqrt(m_q.getX() * m_q.getX() + m_q.getY() * m_q.getY() + m_q.getZ() * m_q.getZ());
343    if (norm == 0.0) {
344      return VecBuilder.fill(0.0, 0.0, 0.0);
345    } else {
346      return VecBuilder.fill(m_q.getX() / norm, m_q.getY() / norm, m_q.getZ() / norm);
347    }
348  }
349
350  /**
351   * Returns the angle in radians in the axis-angle representation of this rotation.
352   *
353   * @return The angle in radians in the axis-angle representation of this rotation.
354   */
355  public double getAngle() {
356    double norm =
357        Math.sqrt(m_q.getX() * m_q.getX() + m_q.getY() * m_q.getY() + m_q.getZ() * m_q.getZ());
358    return 2.0 * Math.atan2(norm, m_q.getW());
359  }
360
361  /**
362   * Returns a Rotation2d representing this Rotation3d projected into the X-Y plane.
363   *
364   * @return A Rotation2d representing this Rotation3d projected into the X-Y plane.
365   */
366  public Rotation2d toRotation2d() {
367    return new Rotation2d(getZ());
368  }
369
370  @Override
371  public String toString() {
372    return String.format("Rotation3d(%s)", m_q);
373  }
374
375  /**
376   * Checks equality between this Rotation3d and another object.
377   *
378   * @param obj The other object.
379   * @return Whether the two objects are equal or not.
380   */
381  @Override
382  public boolean equals(Object obj) {
383    if (obj instanceof Rotation3d) {
384      var other = (Rotation3d) obj;
385      return m_q.equals(other.m_q);
386    }
387    return false;
388  }
389
390  @Override
391  public int hashCode() {
392    return Objects.hash(m_q);
393  }
394
395  @Override
396  public Rotation3d interpolate(Rotation3d endValue, double t) {
397    return plus(endValue.minus(this).times(MathUtil.clamp(t, 0, 1)));
398  }
399}
